titleStmt.title: A. J. Orange et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5916

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Governer of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of Butler county, for years the neighbers and acquaintances of Jas L. Chapman Would respectfully represent that said Chapman was at the last March Term of the Union Circuit Court convicted of horsestealing & Sentenced to the penitentiary for Five years

We futher represent that said Chapman has a wife and three Small children who are left wholly hepless & homeless with no means of Support. That they are Suffering much on account of this confinement of said Chapman and must continue to suffer We further represent that said Chapman is a fit and suitable Subject for the interposition of Executive Clemency and We earnestly invoke the Same in his behalf and pray that you will pardon him and restore him once more to his family for his sake and for their sake hoping and believing that he will henceforth conduct himself as a good citizen if indeed he ever has done otherwise
